At the time, to become a clergyman you

had to have a degree from a university

in England.

I’m not devout

enough to become

a member of the clergy,

but if that’s Father’s wish, then I guess

I have no choice.

Darwin had not studied any classical literature since middle school, but after studying with a private tutor, he was able to enter Cambridge University' s Christ' s College in January 1828.

Brother!

You made it.

Who would have thought we’d meet again so soon,

ha ha.

This is our second cousin, William Darwin Fox.

Long time no see, Charles.

Yeah.

There are about 2,000 students living here

at Cambridge and most of them are children of

the most prestigious families in England.

So you’ll

probably need a lot

of money if you plan

to join their hunting

parties.

I don’t think

I would really fit in with that crowd anyway.
